pullRequest.title: Add `date` complex type to HdfsWritableAvroTest
pullRequest.bodyText:
We convert it to a string in Avro, but it's good to verify that it
works.
Authored-by: Oliver Albertini oalbertini@vmware.com

beforeCommit.message:
Add `date` complex type to HdfsWritableAvroTest

We convert it to a string in Avro, but it's good to verify that it
works.

Authored-by: Oliver Albertini <oalbertini@vmware.com>

afterCommit.message:
Test time type

Authored-by: Oliver Albertini <oalbertini@vmware.com>

nodes.bodyText: @lisakowen I've added these types: date, time, timestamp, and timestamp with time zone. Is there any other Greenplum type you think I should certify?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -53,15 +54,23 @@
             "type_enum_mood mood",
             "type_long_array BIGINT[]",
             "type_numeric_array NUMERIC(8,1)[]",
-            "type_string_array TEXT[]"
+            "type_string_array TEXT[]",
+            "type_date DATE",
+            "type_time TIME",
+            "type_timestamp TIMESTAMP",
+            "type_timestampz TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE"

afterCommit.message:
Add scalar complex types to HdfsWritableAvroTest

We convert it them to strings in Avro, but it's good to verify that it
works. Later we can support writing to the actual logical types[0] in
Avro.

* date
* time
* timestamp
* timestamp with time zone

[0] https://avro.apache.org/docs/current/spec.html#Logical+Types

Authored-by: Oliver Albertini <oalbertini@vmware.com>

beforeCommit.message:
Add scalar complex types to HdfsWritableAvroTest

We convert it them to strings in Avro, but it's good to verify that it
works. Later we can support writing to the actual logical types[0] in
Avro.

* date
* time
* timestamp
* timestamp with time zone

[0] https://avro.apache.org/docs/current/spec.html#Logical+Types

Authored-by: Oliver Albertini <oalbertini@vmware.com>

afterCommit.message:
Add scalar complex types to HdfsWritableAvroTest

We convert it them to strings in Avro, but it's good to verify that it
works. Later we can support writing to the actual logical types[0] in
Avro.

* date
* time
* timestamp
* timestamp with time zone

Also we add testing for primitive character types:

* char
* varchar

These types become strings in Avro, but can still be read back into the
corresponding char types in Postgres.

[0] https://avro.apache.org/docs/current/spec.html#Logical+Types

Authored-by: Oliver Albertini <oalbertini@vmware.com>

commit.message:
Add scalar complex types to HdfsWritableAvroTest

We convert it them to strings in Avro, but it's good to verify that it
works. Later we can support writing to the actual logical types[0] in
Avro.

* date
* time
* timestamp
* timestamp with time zone

Also we add testing for primitive character types:

* char
* varchar

These types become strings in Avro, but can still be read back into the
corresponding char types in Postgres.

[0] https://avro.apache.org/docs/current/spec.html#Logical+Types

Authored-by: Oliver Albertini <oalbertini@vmware.com>
